text: Hello this is Chef John from foodwishes.com with

turkey cocktail meatballs with orange
 cranberry glaze that's right a take-off

on the classic beef cocktail meatballs
done in grape jelly

if you've never had it's quite a
 delicacy well this is a special holiday
version using turkey that's right lean
bland

Tasteless turkey but
here's what we're going to do
we're going to spice it up, all these spices

salt and onion powder by the way if you want

to make this fancy and use fresh onion
 and garlic

go for it but i figured it's the
holidays you're gonna be busy and most of
the people that eat these are going to be pretty drunk

so I'm going to let you use the powdered
version for this recipe only, of course
we're going to have salt in there
And fresh ground black pepper
a little worcester sauce
and then one beaten egg

now don't beat your egg in a separate
 container and then pour it in here just
put it on the side

use a fork to beat it then you don't
have to wash an extra thing see how i
save you time

a little bit of milk we're going to give
that a mix so i like to do i like to
mix the meat turkey in this case

with my wet ingredients first then i
 will sprinkle over my plain breadcrumbs

and mix that together now
 this is a very soft mixture
so very important

that you let this sit a little bit to set up
in the fridge about an hour is fine

so I'm going to wrap this up I'm going to refrigerate for
about an hour

and i'm going to shape them into meat
balls
now what I like to use is a sorbet scoop

because i think it works really nice and
 they all come out the same size
you can just do it with your hands if you want but it you have one of these doodads they

work really nicely by the way one
 production tip

scoop them all first then wet your
hands and they come out into nice round

perfect balls, if you scoop one shape one
 scoop one shape one it just takes longer

oh my God I cannot believe I did not

now what i like to use to turn these
'cause I do want to try to get a brown
on all sides

even though i know it's a ball it doesn't have
a side
so you know what I mean, we're gonna brown them on as many surfaces as possible I like
to use a couple forks
and I think it works very nicely

so just turn those around until they
look like that

I might turn off the heat remove the

 red fresno chiles

it's like you know holiday colors
and then the star of the show

sauce
ribbed for your pleasure ok we are going to use about a half a can of this, this is like
the only use for this product do not use this on your turkey it's kind of gross

but here we're going to melt it with some
 orange marmalade or orange jelly
little bit of water
that's really the base of our glaze

and don't worry about it being all
smooth this is going to totally
breakdown and smooth out
as we cook it with the meatballs
bring that to a simmer
if you use them add your hot peppers

and the rest is easy simply put
your meatballs back in and simmer them
until they're cooked through
and your glaze is reduced
we're going to season with salt and pepper
if needed, taste it of course

now you can adjust at any point here with
more water if it looks like the glaze is
getting too thick

and the meat balls aren't cooked yet add a
splash of water and cook it of a little more

and then if you're like me and my
friends we're a bunch of savages we just eat it

Marth Stewart
